name: la
content:

the sixth note in the sol-fa musical scale

la exclamation
(SINGING)
a word used instead of other words when singing a tune: Everyone was singing, "La, la, la, la, la, la, la".
More examplesFewer examplesThe verses of Deck the Halls each consist of a pair of lines that rhyme, with "fa la la la la / la la la la" in between them.We discussed why we sing fa la la instead of fra spla spla.I remember him with a cigar hanging out of his mouth going "la la la la la la la".

la exclamation
(SHOWING EMOTION)
old use an expression of an emotion, such as surprise or anger: La! You are mistaken!

mainly UK (US usually L.A.) the city of
Los Angeles , in the western US state of California: People try to make it in showbusiness in LA. Just before I was due to fly there, LA was hit by an earthquake.
More examplesFewer examplesAs her acting career took off she moved to LA.LA's crime rate has plummeted in the last ten years.The band performed at a place called Al's Bar in LA.It was a perfectly warm, cloud-free LA day.I used to work for a big LA law firm.
